articles.title: Microsoft and Amazon Are Downgraded as Redburn Breaks Ranks With Peers
articles.body: Microsoft Corp. and Amazon.com Inc. saw their ratings cut to neutral from buy on Tuesday, as Rothschild Co Redburns Alexander Haissl downgraded the stocks for the first time since initiating coverage in June 2022, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. Investors have retreated from AI-related stocks amid unease over stretched valuations. More than 90 percent of the analysts covering the stocks have buy-equivalent recommendations on them with not a single sell rating, according to Bloomberg data.
